column4: Hi all noob here could someone tell me if there is a program that enables you to have a virtual cd drive a bit like daemon tools virtual drive by elby?
you can mount iso files to a directory. no special tools needed
Is there an easy way to do it?
What I'm trying to do is test different distros in vbox without burning the isos
vbox has that feature built in.. no need to do ANY of this ...
I didn't realise it did that
Easier to use than vmware tho
I will try it thanks
Thanks alot you wouldn't happen to know what is the best program to rip audio cds I have tried some and they rip very low or to WAV
most are front ends to the command line tools..  so they can be cofngired to do what you want.
I have come across programs that rip cds but only very low mp3 quality
lol I like high quality music on my ipod without as much loss quality as flac lol
When I used to use mint there was a program called preload which would speed up bootup and performance but I can't see it on here is there any other program you can think of?
ive vaguly recall it mentioned befor. but never tried it or worried about it.
it was called preload on mint so I would have thought beens mint was based on ubuntu
package name is 'preload' it seems...
i dont see much point in not installing them.. :)
It appears I did when I installed Ubuntu but I am on software centre and come across and it shows use this source?
no idea. ive never installed it afterwards
What is gstreamer?
Then convert to flac lol
kenny g lol. sound-juicer option how do you mean?
